rules: Rule1: Provided that candidate John passes the cultural interview, he also passes the technical interview.
Rule2: Whenever candidate John has 5 years of relevant experience, then if his background check passes, he will pass the cultural interview.
Rule3: Either candidate John has 5 years of relevant experience, or he has the AWS certification.
Rule4: Under the condition that candidate John has the AWS certification, then if his background check passes, he passes the cultural interview.
Rule5: Candidate John has a conflict of interest with company Beta, or he is employed.
Rule6: If candidate John withdraws his application, then his application is not pending.
Rule7: Either candidate John withdraws his application, or if he discloses the conflict with company Beta, then he does not have a conflict of interest with company Beta.
Rule8: Whenever candidate John accepts an offer, then he is employed.
Rule9: Candidate John accepts an offer, or he starts employment in Q3 2024.
Rule10: If candidate John starts employment in Q3 2024, then he is assigned mentor employee Sarah.
Rule11: Provided that candidate John completes onboarding in week 2, he is employed.
Rule12: If candidate John receives a laptop, then he completes onboarding in week 2.
Rule13: Whenever candidate John receives access to systems, he receives a laptop.
Rule14: A delay of the start date is requested, or if candidate John is assigned mentor employee Sarah, then he receives access to systems.
Rule15: The offer to candidate John is withdrawn, or if the offer expires, then it is rescinded.
Rule16: Candidate John declines the offer, or it is not the case that the offer is withdrawn.
Rule17: Provided that candidate John receives a counter-offer from company Gamma, he accepts the offer.
Rule18: Candidate John receives a counter-offer from company Gamma, or he receives a higher offer from company Delta.
Rule19: Candidate John negotiates benefits, or if he receives a higher offer from company Delta, then he does not decline the offer.
Rule20: Under the condition that candidate John’s employment is terminated during probation, he violates policy code.
Rule21: Whenever candidate John’s employment is terminated during probation, his performance is not unsatisfactory.
Rule22: If candidate John violates policy code, then he commits misconduct of harassment.
Rule23: Under the condition that candidate John commits misconduct of harassment, his performance is unsatisfactory.
Rule24: Whenever employee Mike, the manager, approves candidate John, then employee Robert, the director, approves candidate John.
Rule25: Provided that employee Lisa, from HR, approves candidate John, then if candidate John starts employment in Q3 2024, he completes onboarding in week 2.
Rule26: Provided that the CEO (employee CEO) approves candidate John, then if employee Robert, the director, approves candidate John, employee Lisa, from HR, approves candidate John.
Rule27: Either the CEO (employee CEO) approves candidate John, or the board chair approves candidate John.
Rule28: If the board chair approves candidate John, then if employee Robert, the director, approves candidate John, employee Lisa, from HR, approves candidate John.
Rule29: If candidate John’s background is suspicious, then his credentials are verified.
Rule30: Provided that an investigation clears candidate John, then if his background is suspicious, his credentials are not verified.
Rule31: Either an investigation clears candidate John, or an investigation is inconclusive for candidate John.
Rule32: The Manager role requires security clearance, or if an investigation is inconclusive for candidate John, then if his background is suspicious, his credentials are not verified.
Rule33: If candidate John is denied secret clearance, then he is not granted secret clearance.
Rule34: Provided that candidate John’s secret clearance is pending, then he is denied secret clearance.

Rule35: Whenever agency X conducts a government review of candidate John, then if it is not the case that if candidate John receives a higher offer from company Delta then he does not decline the offer, his secret clearance is pending.
Rule36: Agency X conducts a government review of candidate John, or vendor Y conducts a third-party review of candidate John.

Rule37: If vendor Y conducts a third-party review of candidate John, then if it is not the case that if candidate John receives a higher offer from company Delta then he does not decline the offer, his secret clearance is pending.
Rule38: Provided that candidate John accepts the offer for the Consultant role, he signs a contract for the Consultant role.

Rule39: Candidate John accepts the offer for the Consultant role, or if it is not the case that if candidate John is not employed then the offer is rescinded, then an offer for the Consultant role is not extended to candidate John.

Rule40: If candidate John accepts the offer for the Advisor role, then if it is not the case that if candidate John is not employed then the offer is rescinded, an offer for the Advisor role is not extended to candidate John.
Rule41: Candidate John signs a contract for the Advisor role, or he accepts the offer for the Advisor role.
Rule42: Whenever candidate John passes the technical interview, his background check does not fail.
Rule43: Under the condition that it is not the case that if candidate John withdraws his application then his application is pending, his application is in review.
Rule44: Provided that it is not the case that if candidate John withdraws his application then his application is pending, his application is not in review.
Rule45: If it is not the case that if candidate John starts employment in Q3 2024 then he is employed, then his employment is terminated during probation.
Rule46: Under the condition that it is not the case that if candidate John starts employment in Q3 2024 then he is employed, counsel Anna, from legal, rejects candidate John.
Rule47: Provided that it is not the case that if candidate John starts employment in Q3 2024 then he is employed, officer David, from compliance, rejects candidate John.
Rule48: If it is not the case that if candidate John receives a higher offer from company Delta then he does not decline the offer, then candidate John is granted secret clearance.

Rule49: Under the condition that it is not the case that if candidate Jane receives an offer for the Developer role then either candidate John receives an offer for the Manager role or if it is not the case that if company Alpha hires candidate John then he is employed then company Alpha hires candidate Jane, candidate Jane negotiates salary.

Rule50: If it is not the case that if officer David, from compliance, rejects candidate John then counsel Anna, from legal, does not reject candidate John, then candidate John’s background is suspicious.

Rule51: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if candidate Jane receives an offer for the Developer role then either candidate John receives an offer for the Manager role or if it is not the case that if company Alpha hires candidate John then he is employed then company Alpha hires candidate Jane then candidate Jane does not negotiate salary, candidate Jane signs a contract.

Rule52: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if candidate Jane receives an offer for the Developer role then either candidate John receives an offer for the Manager role or if it is not the case that if company Alpha hires candidate John then he is employed then company Alpha hires candidate Jane then candidate Jane does not negotiate salary, candidate Jane does not sign a contract.
Rule53: If it is not the case that if candidate John is not employed then the offer is rescinded, then an offer for the Consultant role is extended to candidate John.
Rule54: Under the condition that it is not the case that if candidate John is not employed then the offer is rescinded, an offer for the Advisor role is extended to candidate John.
Rule55: Under the condition that candidate John is not employed, the offer expires.
Rule56: Provided that candidate John is not employed, his background check fails.
facts: Fact1: Company Alpha hires candidate John.
Fact2: Candidate John discloses the conflict with company Beta.
Fact3: Employee Mike, the manager, approves candidate John.
Fact4: Candidate Jane receives an offer for the Developer role.
Fact5: Candidate John’s background check passes.
Fact6: Company Alpha does not hire candidate Jane.
Fact7: A delay of the start date is not requested.
Fact8: The offer to candidate John is not rescinded.
Fact9: Candidate John does not accept the offer.
Fact10: Candidate John does not receive an offer for the Manager role.
Fact11: Candidate John does not negotiate benefits.
Fact12: The Manager role does not require security clearance.
Fact13: Candidate John does not sign a contract for the Consultant role.
Fact14: Candidate John does not sign a contract for the Advisor role.
